intro: Zollikoferiastrum takhtadzhianii, commonly known as the Armenian false dandelion, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky and semi-arid environments. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, with small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. It has a limited distribution and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche. Due to habitat loss and limited study, its conservation status remains uncertain.
